text: Termina was based off a land in which the inhabitants defied the gods so they were cursed and this type of environment was the result
author: Lockhart1433

text: ...beyond those words, there lies a true meaning, and that's what i searched for, i researched and came to this: the fact that the developers say it's a parallel world, it's STRICTLY linked to the fact that they had 1 1/2 years to release the game, right after OoT's release, and they had to reuse many models from OoT, if you think about it, games don't make themselves, there're people behind them, and what they think and do, affects the in game universe, that's why it's "not" a parallel world
author: lightignakelloyd

text: of course it matters, you're forgetting game devlopers are companies, and therefore, they ALL search for money, and therefore, they must back up each other whenever a mistake has happened, don't be naive, and you can't deny that if Ocarina of Time was made because they love their franchise and gave their best, Majora's Mask was made just to keep up the sales while the N64 was the current Nintendo Platform, I know it's officially a parallel world, i know that, but...
author: lightignakelloyd

text: I saw all those things and i still think it isn't a parallel world, characters like Malon and other's models were reused just to complete the game within the short time limit they had to do it, The Parallel world thing is just an explanation the team gave us to understand the reusage of all those things, and actually, the Mask Salesman says he travels in search of masks, how wouldn't he notice he crossed the gap to another world?, assuming gaps looks like the one Link crossed?
author: lightignakelloyd

text: slightly hypocritical there but ok
author: EazyOleMiss

text:
The best thing about this game is the music, because it REALLY makes you feel the situation!

author: Garo

text: @jefferyrlc I have always thought that, being parallel it's an explanation due to the time crisis the developers had to bear, Termina is not Parallel, but it's far away from Hyrule, or maybe not even that far, maybe next to it, being a forest the link between Hyrule and Termina, anyway, my point is that Majora's maybe hooked Link into Termina, so he could easily kill him, and therefore destroy most of the world as it was a mix of skull kid sadness and Majora's anger by being sealed
author: lightignakelloyd

text: I have always thought that, being parallel it's an explanation due to the time crisis the developers had to bear, Termina is not Parallel, but it's far away from Hyrule, or maybe not even that far, maybe next to it, being a forest the link between Hyrule and Termina, anyway, my point is that Majora's maybe hooked Link into Termina, so he could easily kill him, and therefore destroy most of the world as it was a mix of skull kid sadness and Majora's anger because of being sealed

author: jefferyrlc

text: @yogurtman321 This, though I found the time system and emphasis on sidequests frustrating enough for me not to regard the game to be an all-time favorite.  That said, I do prefer Majora's Mask to Ocarina of Time, but I prefer Twilight Princess to both of them.  Twilight Princess, for me, had all the best things about Ocarina of Time and Majora's Mask, but it failed to feel phenomenal enough for me to regard the game as an all-time favorite.

author: Vaughn Campbell

text:
I don't get the obsession with trying to make theories about this game's plot. Not that they're bad or anything, but personally, I don't think this game's plot *needs* an explanation. It was SUPPOSED to kinda be creepy and unexplained. This includes why there is a face on the moon, Majora's Mask itself and other crazy shit that happens in this game.

Termina exists because it just does. (Though it probabally has to do w/ the mask itself)

HOLY CRAP.

author: MysteryAC

text:
I kind of like it though. If you put a bunch of things together, everything makes much more sense. It's almost as if the game never ends, because there are things that happen that make you go "huh?", but then either you figure it out, or someone explains it to you and you're like "Whoa, that's crazy yet it actually makes sense!".

There's this interesting theory about Stone Tower and how it was the Terminian Tower of Babel and stuff. Besides the part about penis it actually makes a lot of sense.
